smartSelectFullWords.regexes.description: Text matching these regexes will be used by Smart Select. Set to empty to disable defaults. If the name is prefixed by `!: `, the match will be selected immediately (bypassing selection of smaller words) when using the `smartSelectFullWords.expand` command (you can then shrink the selection to smaller words by running the builtin Shrink Selection command).
smartSelectFullWords.regexes.// test tailwind: foo-bar-[rgb(1,2,3)] foo[bar] foo-bar/50, foo-bar/[0.2] foo/2 foo@bar@[baz]
smartSelectFullWords.regexes.// catch$all@words1: only excludes chars that can come directly after words in properly styled code
smartSelectFullWords.regexes.// catch$all@words2: (don't want to select `foo(bar` in `foo(bar, baz)` or `baz;` in `foo = baz;`)
smartSelectFullWords.regexes.// catch$all@words3: ends in \w so we don't select periods at ends of sentences or `foo-` in `foo-[bar]`

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
